channel.title: Environmental Variables
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I got a new computer, downloaded Java + JDK, and restarted my computer.
I cannot compile things because my environmental CLASSPATH & PATH are set to the system.
Whats the code for Classpath and Path?
I have java version 6, update 30
JDK version 7, update 2
(the two latest versions.)
Thanks, anthonyduka

item.title: Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

^^ those codes look right to me, its the compiler code teamviewer?

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @anthonyduka anthonyduka
item.description:
@anthonyduka wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:2, topic:431688”]umm idk probably something like this

which ever version of java you want to use
but don’t use both
CLASSPATH AND PATH (JDK 6 UPDATE 30)

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk.1.6.0_30\bin\

CLASSPATH AND PATH ( JDK 7 UPDATE 2)

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\bin

put these in the one that says user variables for (COMPUTER USER)

not the one that says

system variables[/quote]

I have both of those updates installed though.

My path code is:

Classpath code:

Read full topic

umm idk probably something like this

which ever version of java you want to use
but don’t use both

not the one that says
